text: I think I'm looking to network and then improve my design skills. Since i'm a first year, I think having someone to navigate the industry with will be really useful.
Okay, well networking will depend on a few things like location etc :slightly_smiling_face: what is your goal for your first year, your course, and then once you finish? :slightly_smiling_face:

First year: get to grips with the basics, do well and get used to uni, course overall: Become a good game designer, so I can get hired. hopefully I'll have enough skills at the end of this year, so I can make something in the summer and then use it for applying for placements ect.

What course are you studying? When you say games designer what do you want to focus on? :slightly_smiling_face: Maybe it's better to think about after university what would be your ideal job title? ^^
Gameplay design and production. <https://www.staffs.ac.uk/course/computer-gameplay-design-production-bsc> maybe combat designer or similar.

attachments.title: Computer Gameplay Design and Production
attachments.text: If you love the idea of developing exciting and experimental games, this degree is for you. It's ideal if you're interested in a career as a games designer.
